changelog.entry: ENGI_SURRENDER has an option to attack the Engi ship
If you choose to explain that you're friendly in ENGI_SURRENDER, you have a chance to also get a free map reveal

event.name: ENGI_IMMEDIATE_SURRENDER
event.text: An Engi ship in the vicinity, seeing you jump in armed to the teeth, immediately broadcasts its surrender: "Subject goal: wealth. Engi motivation: survival. Transfer of goods acceptable?"
The Engi seem relieved, and eager to get underway. They set off without saying goodbye.

The Engi are satisfied with your explanation. "Beneficial. Subject goal: long, long journey. Remains compatible with transfer of goods from Engi." They send over the gear willingly, and you feel better for it.
The Engi obediently transfer over the goods and get on their way. Money for nothing.

event.name: ALISON_MANTIS_CREW
event.text: You arrive just in time to see an unusually well-armed Engi ship destroying a small pirate craft. A teleporter signal is detected...intruder on deck!

A young Mantis in a charred uniform has teleported onto the deck. He begs for sanctuary from the Engi, and offers to serve in exchange for your protection. The Engi have already traced the teleporter signal and are offering a deal in exchange for the prisoner.

choice.text: Side with the fugitive and fight the Engi ship.

event.text: It was a trap! The Mantis sabotages your ship before teleporting away.
He expresses his thanks and prepares to help you fight his pursuer.

choice.text: Agree to offer up the Mantis in exchange for a bounty.

event.text: The Engi captain is delighted, and quickly arranges for the transfer of the prisoner.
Fury sparks in the eyes of the Mantis. He won't go easily, and causes serious damage before he can be captured.
The pursuing ship responds with a completely unintelligible message. The young Mantis jerks to attention and assumes a battle stance. It was a trap!

changelog.entry: Added a distress signal to ENGI_STATION_DISTRESS event

event.name: ENGI_STATION_DISTRESS
event.text: You receive a distress call from a nearby Engi ship. "Assistance requested. Danger present. Imminent destruction."

choice.text: Respond to the call and move in to assist.

event.text: You receive another message from the ship, this time with a Mantis at the comm-log. "Foolish meatsacks," he yells. Sensors indicate the ship is moving in to attack and boarders teleport from the station.
You approach to find a Mantis ship assaulting a small Engi space station. You prepare for a fight!

deadCrew.text: No more life signs detected on the Mantis ship. You hasten to contact the Engi.

event.text: The Engi station is stripped bare and there are signs of a fierce battle. The Mantis must have left the distress call active to lure other ships into a trap.
The station was in the process of being evacuated. A number of civilian Engi offer their gratitude as they finalize their preparations to leave. They offer some fuel as a reward.
The station hails you, "Gratitude. Expected probability of defeat without assistance... 86.2 percent. Request suitable reward."
"Request granted. Fuel transferring."
"Request granted. Weapon transferring."
"Request granted. Drone schematic transferring."

choice.text: (Engi Crew) Threat unresolved. Current mission imperative: Protocol 52.34.

event.text: They respond, "Understood. Re-establishment of Federation highest import. Transmitting hidden base coordinates. Repairing hull and attaching ship to ship ordnance."
They thank you for the assistance and when you tell them of your mission, one of the Engi asks if they can assist your crew. You welcome them aboard.

event.name: ENGI_SEX
event.text: What appeared to be a single damaged ship is in fact two ships that have smashed into each other... there is a flurry of comm signals and damage, and it's hard to determine what occurred. The vessels appear to be... Engi? They look locked together by the impact and can't free themselves.

choice.text: Attempt to help the ships by prying them apart.

event.text: To your surprise, one of the Engi vessels attacks! One ship detaches itself, surprisingly still quite whole, and opens fire - it looks like it's somehow identified you as hostile!

destroyed.text: With the ship destroyed, the remaining Engi ship hails you frantically and explains the situation to you.

event.text: Apparently, you interrupted the equivalent of a "consolidation" of two ships that were using each other's parts to construct a new vessel. The Engi were not truly hostile, their targeting computers had not finished adjusting. There's nothing to be done about it now. You leave the remains for the surviving ship.

deadCrew.text: With the ship disabled, the remaining Engi ship hails you frantically and explains the situation to you.

event.text: Apparently, you interrupted the equivalent of a "consolidation" of two ships that were using each other's parts to construct a new vessel. The Engi were not truly hostile, their targeting computers had not finished adjusting. There's nothing to be done about it now. You leave the remains for the surviving ship.

choice.text: (Engi) Have your Engi crewmember hail the vessel and assess the damage.

event.text: Your Engi crewmember refuses. In a halting use of adjectives and nouns, followed by some animated holographic aids, the Engi explains the ships are... using each other to, loosely translated, "achieve a union." For some reason, this consolidation of ship matter sounds embarrassing and personal.

You elect to leave the two Engi ships... to their "business." After questioning your Engi crewmember, however, you do manage to salvage what scrap parts you can from the perimeter, even though you feel slightly dirty for doing so.

event.name: ENGI_LOOT
event.text: The complex arrangements of ship hulls and FTL drive capacitors floating abandoned in space suggest the Engi were here not too long ago; but no longer.
You chose a ship to loot at random. It turned out to contain a functioning drone schematic.
The first ship you stumbled upon was loaded with high quality FTL fuel. You decided not to waste more time here and prepare to jump.
Before you managed to get to the closest abandoned ship, an Engi patrol appeared out of nowhere: "Purpose unknown. Question mark." You are prompted to explain yourself.

choice.text: "Well, I just wanted to loot some Engi ships."

event.text: The Engi ship finds your response offensive and powers its weapons and drones.

choice.text: (Engi) Current mission: 155.02. Target location: 63.14. Assistance required.

event.text: The Engi ship responds, "Affirmative. Dispatching necessary resources."

choice.text: Don't risk it: charge the FTL drive.

changelog.text: Added Engi ship selling sensors event heavily inspired by Arsenal+ event.

event.name: ENGI_SELLING_SENSORS
event.text: An Engi research ship offers a variety of sensors, scanners and detectors for sale. You're looking for options that would fit your ship class.
The Engi are quick to install a sensors system. While useful for gathering information, you doubt it will be able to function in nebula.
The Engi are quick to upgrade your sensors system. While useful for gathering information, you doubt it will be able to function in nebula.
The Engi are quick to upgrade your sensors system. While useful for gathering information, you doubt it will be able to function in nebula.
You transfer the payment but it takes some time for Engi merchants to bring the goods to your ship.
The Engi install their newest invention, an augmentation, very useful for traversing nebula. Satisfied with your purchase, you prepare to make an FTL jump.

The Engi bring a Slug in a tight capsule, hardly able to move. They have very different interpretations of a 'Lifeform scanner'. Finally free from torturers, the SLug agrees to join your crew for a time.

choice.text: This treatment is unacceptable! Attack the Engi.
Leave the Engi alone. At least, the SLug is safe with you now.
